title: How many older players feel like they only play 2-5 champs due to reworks?
body:
Rolling back the years to season 1 and season 2 I played just about every champ on the roster, and about every build for said champs. Be it AP Magewick, Triple Doran's Roaming Garen bot, 100% dodge Jax, Soraka support, Mana Tank Ryze, or insert X here. About anything you can come up with I tried and likely enjoyed at one point in time or another.

Flash forward to season 6-9 and the amount of champions I enjoy playing amount to... Jinx and Garen.

Now why is that you think? Used to love Ryze, Galio, Akali, Fiora, Soraka, Jax, Kayle,Nida, Maokai, Mord, you name it. I loved playing off the wall non-meta builds, weird rune combos, and simply being able to look at the roster and go "there are 50+ champs that are fun with 4-5 viable builds for each."

All these reworks, new items, mastery changes, ect how many of the players that played season 1 and 2 are even still around? How many of you can honestly say you wouldn't prefer a previous Season? Pick a season 1 through 5. League just no longer plays like league. 

These days all fight resolve in under 3 seconds, at any given time maybe 30 champs are even played and each of those champs has at MOST 2 viable builds. If I had to pick when things really went south, I'd say between the addition of devourer and the tank ekko nerfs. Everything after that has been crap.

THe only "good" rework was the WW one, and even it has issues. The main issue being it's pretty much limited to playing it tanky/bruiser jungle.

I feel like the whole game has been balanced around a "pro scene" that I don't even watch. Honestly why can't the game just be targeted toward "fun for the majority of players" and let the pros sort out amongst themselves what's the most broken.

Counterpoint, players complain like crazy whenever someone builds off-meta or when a non-meta champion is played in a non-meta position. People absolutely flipped their shit when AP Yi was destroying games, for example. They also complain that champions are too generalist and too good at everything.

There is a difference between an off build being absurdly broken and getting deleted, and offbuilds that were balanced, like AP Varus, just getting deleted by random changes no one cared and didnt really buff the main build.

people complained about AP yi because he was unkillable at the same time as he 1v5'd your team...all of his abilities used to have AP ratios but as an auto-attack reliant champion, it was not thought at the time that he could make use of AP items

he was among the primary causes of the AP and AD split from kits

generalists are a completely different problem.  They have never been healthy for the game.  They either have to be completely underpowered, or they're a must pick because they can do what the specialists can and what everyone else can with few drawbacks or weaknesses

Take Jax, Jax is a generalist...  Very high damage, crowd control, mobility, takes towers, only requires any one thing at any point in time to push him over the edge (Runes reforged did that), can match most matchups in his favor, scales well, flexible build path, decent defenses...

so much stuff you can list that he has and does when his weaknesses are limited to:  item reliant, short ranged, and no counters to ability-based champions

Then when Jax is one of the most MINOR cases of generalists, league has a severe problem now

Unless someone that cares about her is given some kind of decision making power, she will continue to be doomed to be a mediocre and generic enchanter support instead of the anti-assassin battlemage with team utility she was.

I've been playing since mid-season 3 (Lissandra's release), and looking back, I say I got until mid-season 4 before this game started taking turns for the worse.

With regard to reworks specifically, the majority is something I personally would like to see reverted. But then I am very conservative in my playstyle, and generally not a fan of big changes. 

But a few specific examples: Fiora and Irelia. These 2 in particular are champions I used to enjoy. But with their rework, I find I don't really understand them anymore. Also, with them having both turned so mechanical, I find myself not having low enough ping to play them properly anymore. 
Not using that as an excuse to want them reverted, but I don't find them fun to play anymore, because I feel hardware limited on them. Less fun for me is the keyword.

While I can "play" probably half of the champions, there is only a handful I have "fun" with. Big difference.

Major changes: The "new" Summoner's Rift. I liked the graphics style of the old map - or should I say "old game", old client included - much better. It's what drew me to this in the first place, coming from DoTA. The original art style was just spot-on for a game such as this.

But the new art style turned so cartoonish, I didn't like it anymore. And so I turned to ARAM instead, only leaving the Howling Abyss to do the barest minimum of ranked games to get the free skin every season.

Same with the game client itself - yes, it may have been flawed and its coding being a hopeless mess and whatever, but it had _character_. Something the new client is utterly lacking - its coding is apparently still a mess, and it managed to lose all its charm in the process.

Runes and masteries: RIP old system. The old system offered variety to a much, much larger degree than the new one. And when I learned some runes are map-specific (Waterwalking) - or even forcibly changed if "wrong" (like Magical Footwear on Cassiopeia or Ultimate Hunter on Jayce) - I lost all interest in them.
My 2 fav champs were Akali and Irelia, but then both of them were deleted from the game.

I mean the reworks definitely changed my champion pool. But I also enjoyed some of the new champs that came out like {{champion:203}} and {{champion:136}} . On the other hand I used to main {{champion:55}} and {{champion:13}} and now I don't enjoy playing those champs at all due to the reworks.

It's a different game from when I started. In some ways it's better and in some ways it's worse. But the game is constantly evolving and will never be perfect. There was no "glory" period because the game always had huge flaws every single season and people bitched about it back then just as much as they do now.

I will say that the desire to balance around the pro scene has robbed the game of some its original flexibility. Consider a champion like Evelyn who has been relegated to only taking the JG role (whereas in the past, she could feasibly assign herself to a number of roles).  It definitely feels lame that there are so few viable build options for each given champion : /.

Started playing season 3, used to like urgot, graves, shen, gangplank, darius, fiora, kat, AP nunu, ryze, vlad. After their reworks they all became less fun and the only ones I still rarely play are ryze, shen, and darius. I really want riot to go the blizzard route and give us a way to go back to season 2 or 3 so people who don't like s9 can still have fun playing the league they loved.

But as for off-meta picks/builds being bad I think that's the fault of all the 3rd party websites. People can instantly see the best champions, best runes, and best builds. If an off-meta pick/build is actually good, it will instantly become meta because everyone will see it on the websites and every youtuber will make a video about it. Before s5 you had to figure it all out by word of mouth or your own experimentation.

I don't mind a lot of the reworks honestly. I hate Akali's, and I hate what this patch did to Ryze. And I'd be lying if I said I didn't miss most of the old-school, pre-reworked kits and builds (Pre-reworked AP Sion, for example). But I don't think the majority of the champion reworks were necessarily where they went wrong on delivering. I think it's more just in the meta-pushing.

Like you said, there was a time you could play just about anything, almost anywhere, and still have a fun game. I remember AD Janna mid being *almost* popular at one point. I remember bot lane Ziggs, or the "toxic" bot lane of Cass with Teemo or Singed. I remember when tank junglers could still clear with enough viability to matter, and I remember when damage junglers were still healthy enough to gank without going back after 2-3 camps and realizing the enemy already took scuttle. I remember mage junglers other than Fiddlesticks and Karthas *used to exist*, and that some of them were actually *good!*

It's all starting to feel like a forced binary. Nothing's really built to be *played* anymore, more than it's built to *perform* a single role. That goes for items, runes, champions, you name it...every aspect of this game has went from feeling like an open-ended 5v5 between legendary champions who can do anything, to feeling like a more complex rock-paper-scissors game based around champions built to beat X, fail to Y, and stay in line with Z.
